properties.description: We cater for all. A full cafe is open on Tuesday and Wednesday and on Monday the cafe space is available. People do work in here with laptops and we have disabled access and toilets. We have a car park with free parking to building users and a bike shelter.

properties.title: HT Hub

properties.description: When: Monday to Wednesday, 10.30am - 2.30pm Fancy a cuppa? Fancy a chat? Or a place to just relax in the warm? Come and join us in our living room! Everyone is welcome and we can't wait to meet you!Free tea and coffee is available to all - as well as clothes and fresh fruit and veg to take home. Every Monday we restock our food stall and have tinned goods available as well. All completely free!Donations (of goods and money) are welcome.

properties.description: When: Monday to Friday 10am to 4pmSt Sampsons Centre has lots to offer older people in the York area. properties.description: When: Monday to Friday 2pm to 4.30pmWe know things are looking harder for lots of people at the moment and life can seem overwhelming. At Holy Trinity, Heworth we'd love to welcome those who are looking for community, a warm cup of tea, a piece of cake and some free-of-charge activities to our brand new HT Hub. Launching weekly from Sunday 30th October, in the afternoons between 2pm and 4.30pm, come along to the church hall on Melrosegate for a warm, friendly, drop-in space to have a

New Earswick Quakers and New Earswick Helping Hands invite you to The Quaker Meeting House at the back of the Folk Hall car park every and any Friday between 2pm and 5pm. properties.address: Oaken Grove Community Centre, Reid Park, Haxby, York, YO32 3QW, YO32 3QW
properties.description: When: Tuesdays 10.30 - 12.30We are proud to be a designated Warm Place as part of City of York Council's "Good Place Warm Place" initiative. Join us from 10:30am every Tuesday in the Oak Tree Room at Oaken Grove Community Centre throughout winter. Hot food and refreshments will be available through the reading café. No purchase necessary to attend this warm place. For more information email info@hwyca.co.uk or ring 01904 769176.

properties.description: Monday 12pm-4pm, Tuesday 11am-2.30pm & Thursday 12am - 4pm.Bellfarm Social Hall offers a warm space with free tea, coffee, biscuits, soups, books and chat. We also offer a foodbank daily. No vouchers or referals are needed. We are not area specific. It doesnt matter where you come from you are welcome.

properties.description: Thursdays: 12.30pm-4.00pmOn the following dates: 2nd, 9th and 23rd February and 2nd and 9th of March (no session on 16th February).Join us for soup, sandwiches and hot drinks in the cosy hall at St Nicks Environment Centre. We have a great selection of games, puzzles and magazines to pass the time. Join us for a social chat, wellbeing support and a warm welcome.
